doc.title: Petrochemical Majors | Japan
doc.source_uri: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.2 普通个人版/MS/Petrochemical Majors Petchem Prices in 4th Week of Aug Conditions Improving Though Moves Are ModestPetrochemical Majors _2025-08-31

processing_metadata.publication: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.2 普通个人版/MS
processing_metadata.input_relative_path: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.2 普通个人版/MS

passages.text: August 31, 2025 07:47 PM GMT

While naphtha market prices continue to rise, petchem prices are showing a favorable trend, either increasing or remaining flat for more items, indicating ongoing improvement in conditions. Industry restructuring is spreading across Asia, with moves to downsize naphtha crackers in the region. We view petchem market sentiment as improving. Due to rising raw material prices, margins are mostly deteriorating.

Amid a continuing rise in the price of naphtha, prices for 21 petrochemical products were up for 8, flat for 9, down for 4: Prices \(+0.3\%\) WoW for Dubai crude and \(+2.3\%\) for Singapore naphtha. The spread between crude oil and naphtha was a negative \(\) 4.5\(,\) +\) 1.2 WoW. Natural gas was \(- 7.5\%\) , methanol \(- 0.6\%\) .

Monomer price moves small, but mostly upward: WoW (unless otherwise specified), ethylene was \(+0.6\%\) , propylene flat, BZ (benzene) \(+0.7\%\) , toluene flat, SM (styrene monomer) \(+1.7\%\) , BD (butadiene) \(+2.1\%\) , phenol \(+0.6\%\) , \(- 1.8\%\) for acetone. No weekly update for BPA. VCM (vinyl chloride monomer) flat. MMA flat. No weekly updates for pMDI (polymeric MDI), mMDI (monomeric MDI) or TDI. Monomer- related products saw price rises predominate slightly, and conditions continue to turn up. In Asia, naphtha cracker downsizing moves are emerging, and we think sentiment is improving.

Polymers mostly flat, some polyolefin weakness: LDPE (low density polyethylene) \(- 2.5\%\) , HDPE (high density polyethylene) flat. PP (polypropylene) - \(1.1\%\) . PS (polystyrene) flat, ABS flat. PVC (vinyl chloride resin) flat. No weekly update for PC.

Fiber intermediate price predominantly moved higher: \(+3.6\%\) for PX (paraxylene), \(+2.3\%\) for PTA (purified terephthalic acid), \(+0.9\%\) for EG (ethylene glycol), flat for AN (acrylonitrile). CPL (caprolactam) \(- 0.3\%\) .

Margin mostly deteriorated, due to rising raw materials prices: The ethylene margin (naphtha cracker margin) was - \(28 at\) 160. Margins, which broadly price in co- product credits, appear higher than the overall data. BD- naphtha spread was \(+\) 5 to \(\) 399\(. In BZ derivatives, SM +\) 9, phenol (incl. byproduct acetone) - \(\) 7\(; no weekly update for pMDI or mMDI. CPL -\) 9. No weekly update for BPA. MMA +\) 9. No weekly update for TDI. For polymers, - \(\) 45\(for LDPE, -\) 20 for HDPE. PP -\) 30, PS - \(\) 16\(, ABS -\) 12. PVC - \(\) 3\(, no weekly update for PC. Synthetic fiber raw materials saw PTA -\) 5. EG +\) 2, AN flat.
MORGAN STANLEY MUFG SECURITIES CO., LTD +
Petrochemical Majors: JPCA Stats (July): Ethylene Capacity Utilization Up MoM (21 Aug 2025)

Exhibit 1: Major petrochemical product prices & spreads

Source: Bloomberg, ICIS, IHS, Morgan Stanley Research
Note: pMDI/tMDI/TDI/PC/BPA data are monthly updated (Data = previous month)

Production capacity calculation method: Based on the production capacity data of FY19, we have listed the top production capacity of Japanese chemical companies. For the JV companies, production capacity is calculated by counting according to the share holding ratio.

Spread calculation method: Calculated by subtracting the raw material price multiplied by the basic unit from the product price based on the Asian market price. Only for the naphtha cracker margin, fuel costs and co- products were taken into account.

The Stock Ratings described below apply to Morgan Stanley's Fundamental Equity Research and do not apply to Debt Research produced by the Firm. For disclosure purposes only (in accordance with FINRA requirements), we include the category headings of Buy, Hold, and Sell alongside our ratings of Overweight, Equal- weight, Not- Rated and Underweight. Morgan Stanley does not assign ratings of Buy, Hold or Sell to the stocks we cover. Overweight, Equal- weight, Not- Rated and Underweight are not the equivalent of buy, hold, and sell but represent recommended relative weightings (see definitions below). To satisfy regulatory requirements, we correspond Overweight, our most positive stock rating, with a buy recommendation; we correspond Equal- weight and Not- Rated to hold and Underweight to sell recommendations, respectively.

Data include common stock and ADRs currently assigned ratings. Investment Banking Clients are companies from whom Morgan Stanley received investment banking compensation in the last 12 months. Due to rounding off of decimals, the percentages provided in the % of total' column may not add up to exactly 100 percent.

Overweight (O). The stock's total return is expected to exceed the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12-18 months.

Equal-weight (E). The stock's total return is expected to be in line with the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12-18 months.

Not-Rated (NR). Currently the analyst does not have adequate conviction about the stock's total return relative to the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12-18 months.

Underweight (U). The stock's total return is expected to be below the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12-18 months.
Unless otherwise specified, the time frame for price targets included in Morgan Stanley Research is 12 to 18 months.
Attractive (A): The analyst expects the performance of his or her industry coverage universe over the next 12-18 months to be attractive vs. the relevant broad market benchmark, as indicated below.

In-Line (I): The analyst expects the performance of his or her industry coverage universe over the next 12-18 months to be in line with the relevant broad market benchmark, as indicated below.Cautious (C): The analyst views the performance of his or her industry coverage universe over the next 12-18 months with caution vs. the relevant broad market benchmark, as indicated below.Benchmarks for each region are as follows: North America - S&P 500; Latin America - relevant MSCI country index or MSCI Latin America Index; Europe - MSCI Europe; Japan - TOPIX; Asia -relevant MSCI country index or MSCI sub-regional index or MSCI AC Asia Pacific ex Japan Index.
